results.content:
Introduction: started off slow with information that was not needed.
What was needed: a display of Name, E-Mail, etc.
Terms that are not known, i.e. JS Front End, Back End, PHP, get hrop, Alcygla?, FireFox, IDE, Jet Storm, Mean Stack, 3 Source, etc. Now I'll have look up these terms to try and understand why they were mention at this time.

results.content: I'm only about 20% in but so far it seems the instructor would benefit greatly from creating and following a more detailed outline.  There is lots of rambling and second guessing himself.  It would also be super useful to have use-cases for more advanced topics, such as the bitwise portion of the operator section.  I can see this being VERY confusing for most viewers.

results.content:
The guy knows his stuff inside out, but his teaching methods are shit.
He waffles on, then realises what he's trying to demonstrate isn't happening, interspersed with a lot of err's between sentences.
He hasn't really thought out/planned how he's going to present it.
Really disappointed.
